Wasn't that suppose to be to racist even for Japan. You need to see at 
least one episode of Escaflonase in your lifetime. And if you are 
talking about how they call out there attacks on rare occasions let it 
be noted that those attacks clearly require extreme concentration.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Abyssian Badass" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: May I suggest Cowboy Bebop? Excellent Anime, excellent, yes. 
Well, I note that Dragon Ball Z has one MAJOR flaw. The English 
version. Yep, that's right, the English version. Do yourself a favor 
and get yourself subtitled Japanese versions of it, it wasn't, and 
isn't anything like the English version...
> 
>   ----- Original Message -----
>   From: Kyle Stewart
>   To: nbwrpg@y...
>   Sent: Monday, October 29, 2001 11:38 AM
>   Subject: Re: 2
> 
> 
>   DON'T YOU DARE PUT ALL ANIME IN THE SAME STUPID
>   LOOPHOE WITH POKEMON! EVER SEEN GUNDAM (any of them),
>   ESCAFLONASE, OUTLAW STAR, DBZ, THE EARLY SAILOR MOON
>   CARTOONS, OR THE 08TH MS TEAM (I'm listing it seperate
>   from the other Gundam cartoons because it deserves to
>   be listed twice).
> 
>   --- robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
>   > Alloran is right about RID, and all the other
>   > things. Gobots was a rival
>   > show, about the same, but it didnt have no where
>   > near the impact with
>   > storyline, or creating a whole universe. Their toys
>   > were quite inferior,
>   > and eventually Hasbro put them out of buisness, then
>   > bought the rights
>   > to it. That's why for a while in Generation 2 they
>   > had characters named
>   > Gobot, it was a shot in the face.
>   > 
>   > I would have liked to see the Beast Wars that the
>   > writers would have
>   > made if they had total control and an unlimited
>   > budget. In my opinion
>   > the guys who wrote that show were geniuses.
>   > 
>   > I like RID, but I am not to fond of how Anime it is.
>   > I'm not a big fan
>   > of Japanese cartoons, and this one is no exeption,
>   > it dosent take itself
>   > seriously. The animation is beautiful however, but
>   > the stories are not
>   > very compeling. However I have read rumors that
>   > Takara or Hasbro (i'm
>   > not sure which one is the owner) will make a brand
>   > new series soon
>   > revolving around Generation 1, but this is just a
>   > rumor.
>   > 
>
